cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north-northwest tonight then accelerate north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, crossing northern Florida and moving into the western Atlantic late Thursday-Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / north-central Gulf Coast of Florida

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle eastward and portions of the southeast Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible in outer rain bands Wednesday night into Thursday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises <2 ft possible, mainly east of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain in intermittent outer bands Wednesday-Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights in approaches may disrupt vessel movements
